wiki.content:
The Vishnu sahasranāma (literally: "the thousand names of Vishnu") is a list of 1,000 names for Vishnu, one of the main forms of God in Hinduism and the personal supreme God for Vaishnavas (followers of Vishnu). It is also one of the most sacred and commonly chanted stotras in Hinduism. The Vishnu sahasranama as found in the Mahabharata is the most popular version of the 1000 names of Vishnu. Another version exists in the Padma Purana. [Source : Wikipedia]
 
 Vishnu Sahasranamam has been rendered by countless scholars and musicians but all of that simply fades in comparison to this rendition by MS. The clarity of pronunciation (which she got right by studying Sanskrit), the oozing devotion, the honey-like voice and an ability to see God in the music she renders makes this and almost every other rendition of hers truly divine.  Her music is a way to reach God and makes the listener experience divinity innately.

It is also one of the most sacred and commonly chanted stotras in Hinduism. The Vishnu sahasranama as found in the Mahabharata is the most popular version of the 1000 names of Vishnu. Another version exists in the Padma Purana.
